body:
to reproduce:
create vagrant kubernetes with 5 minions. try guest book example on it. After provisioning:

```
nidd@host-1:~/src/kubernetes$ cluster/kubecfg.sh list pods
ID                                     Image(s)                   Host                    Labels                                                       Status
----------                             ----------                 ----------              ----------                                                   ----------
redis-master-2                         dockerfile/redis           10.245.2.6/10.245.2.6   name=redis-master                                            Running
d85fb6b7-3ea8-11e4-b333-0800279696e1   brendanburns/redis-slave   10.245.2.4/10.245.2.4   name=redisslave,replicationController=redisSlaveController   Running
d863fa8a-3ea8-11e4-b333-0800279696e1   brendanburns/redis-slave   10.245.2.2/10.245.2.2   name=redisslave,replicationController=redisSlaveController   Running
c2ab8d98-3eab-11e4-b333-0800279696e1   brendanburns/php-redis     10.245.2.2/10.245.2.2   name=frontend,replicationController=frontendController       Running
c2b22f05-3eab-11e4-b333-0800279696e1   brendanburns/php-redis     10.245.2.4/10.245.2.4   name=frontend,replicationController=frontendController       Running
c2b60636-3eab-11e4-b333-0800279696e1   brendanburns/php-redis     10.245.2.6/10.245.2.6   name=frontend,replicationController=frontendController       Running
```

then kill 10.245.2.6 minion:

```
nidd@host-1:~/src/kubernetes$ vagrant halt -f minion-5
==> minion-5: Forcing shutdown of VM...
```

then we get:

```
nidd@host-1:~/src/kubernetes$ cluster/kubecfg.sh list pods
ID                                     Image(s)                   Host                    Labels                                                       Status
----------                             ----------                 ----------              ----------                                                   ----------
redis-master-2                         dockerfile/redis           10.245.2.6/             name=redis-master                                            Running
d85fb6b7-3ea8-11e4-b333-0800279696e1   brendanburns/redis-slave   10.245.2.4/10.245.2.4   name=redisslave,replicationController=redisSlaveController   Running
d863fa8a-3ea8-11e4-b333-0800279696e1   brendanburns/redis-slave   10.245.2.2/10.245.2.2   name=redisslave,replicationController=redisSlaveController   Running
c2ab8d98-3eab-11e4-b333-0800279696e1   brendanburns/php-redis     10.245.2.2/10.245.2.2   name=frontend,replicationController=frontendController       Running
c2b22f05-3eab-11e4-b333-0800279696e1   brendanburns/php-redis     10.245.2.4/10.245.2.4   name=frontend,replicationController=frontendController       Running
c2b60636-3eab-11e4-b333-0800279696e1   brendanburns/php-redis     10.245.2.6/             name=frontend,replicationController=frontendController       Running
```

Nothing changes even after waiting for significant period of time.

Please note, that while redis-master wasn't in replication controller and it's not expected for it to restart, it's still wrongfully marked as Running.

title: Crashing a minion doesn't lead to creation of new pods in replication controller
